title: Quiz 4: Tropical Vectors
description: Exploration of African Sleeping Sickness, Kala Azar, Bilharzia, and Plague vectors and management.

questions.question: Match the tropical disease with its primary insect or animal vector:
questions.explanation: Vectors transmit parasites: Glossina (Trypanosoma), Phlebotomus (Leishmania), Simulium (Onchocerca), Xenopsylla (Yersinia pestis).
questions.hint: Think of the specific flies and fleas.

questions.question: Which form of African Trypanosomiasis is acute, rapid, and common in Eastern Africa (e.g., south-east Uganda)?
questions.explanation: T.b. rhodesiense causes acute illness with rapid progression and cardiac complications.

questions.question: Which of the following are clinical manifestations of Schistosomiasis (Bilharzia) in the late stage? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Late schistosomiasis causes severe scarring in the bladder (cancer) and liver (portal hypertension).
questions.hint: Think of blood in urine and liver damage.

questions.question: The infective stage of the Schistosome that penetrates human skin in water is the ___BLANK___, while the intermediate host required for its development is the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Cercariae penetrate the skin; snails (Biomphalaria or Bulinus) are the intermediate hosts.
questions.hint: Think of the 'fork-tailed' larvae and the slow-moving creature.

questions.question: A patient presents with sudden high fever, headache, and painfully swollen lymph nodes (buboes) in the groin. What is the most likely diagnosis?

richContent.content:
Case Scenario

A farmer reports finding dead rats in his grain store. Two days later, he develops severe fever and a large, painful 'bubo' in his armpit.

questions.explanation: The presence of buboes and the connection to dead rats are diagnostic indicators of Bubonic Plague (Yersinia pestis).
questions.hint: Rat fleas move to humans after rats die.

questions.question: What is the common name for Visceral Leishmaniasis, characterized by fever, enlarged spleen, and extreme weight loss?
questions.explanation: Kala Azar is the visceral form of leishmaniasis, transmitted by sandflies.

questions.question: Arrange the life cycle of Onchocerca volvulus (River Blindness) starting from the Blackfly bite:

items.text: Larvae mature into adult worms in nodules
Adult worms produce millions of microfilariae
Microfilariae migrate to skin and eyes

questions.explanation: Larvae enter through a bite, mature in subcutaneous nodules, and then flood the body with microfilariae that damage the eyes.
questions.hint: Bite -> Nodule -> Millions of tiny worms -> Blindness.

questions.question: Which antibiotic is a common treatment for Plague (Yersinia pestis)?
questions.explanation: Streptomycin is highly effective against Y. pestis, as are tetracyclines.

questions.question: Tick-borne relapsing fever can be passed from a mother tick to its offspring (vertical transmission).
questions.explanation: Unlike louse-borne fever, the spirochaetes in ticks infect their eggs, meaning a house can remain dangerous for years.
